title: High Score Leaderboard Sort
description:
# Problem Description

Write a program that processes a list of player high scores and sorts them to generate a leaderboard. Each entry consists of a player's name (String) and their score (Integer).

The leaderboard must be sorted according to the following two rules:

1. **Primary Sort:** Entries must be sorted primarily by **Score** in **descending** order (highest score first).
2. **Secondary Sort (Tie-breaker):** If two or more entries have the same score, they must be sorted by **Player Name** in **ascending** alphabetical order (A-Z).

## Input

The first line of input contains an integer $N$ (the number of player entries, $1 \le N \le 50$).

The following $N$ lines each contain a player entry, consisting of a string (the player name, containing no spaces) followed by an integer (the score, $0 \le \text{Score} \le 1000$).

## Output

Output the $N$ entries, sorted according to the rules described, one entry per line. Each line should contain the Player Name followed by a space, followed by the Score.
